Reviews.Title: “This is a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: I was on my way to L.A. and needed a hotel in the north area of San Diego just to spend the night and be on my way early on the next day. From the moment we got there, felt sorry that we we're not going to be able to spend more time at the hotel. It is new, modern, and clean. The rooms are spacious and also the bathroom, with a large vanity area. ( a plus for 3 women travelling together!) Beds are comfortable, bedding feels like is new. Everything was impeccable. Complimentary breakfast is a buffet with fresh fruit, eggs, sides, oatmeal, waffle station, cereals, yoghurt, juices and more. Service at breakfast was very good also. Overall we had a great experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping next to the Freeway”
Reviews.Author: JDG2010
Reviews.Content: I must first compliment the staff on impeccable service. They went above and beyond to accommodate us, were very efficient, polite and went above and beyond to take care of their guests. However, they had no control over the road noise from the near by on ramp.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LineNoise
Reviews.Content: Alright, when I got to this hotel I had been on the road for 4 months. I had to drive down from Burbank and I just wanted to go home, but still had a few days left and I more site to complete. I got to the hotel, went up to my room and there was a plate with an apple, banana, peanut butter, crackers and I was STARVING! I was so happy to see this you can't even imagine. The room doesn't stand out, so it must have been fine. I remember it overlooked the pool. Now the best part, the restaurant! You cannot beat the happy hour! John is awesome! Food was great and the beer was better. I hope to get back here soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BPCGA
Reviews.Content: I noticed that this hotel won a few Service Awards in the last few years and I would say that those awards were well deserved. This is a very quiet and clean hotel where all of the staff from the front desk, to the shuttle drivers to the servers in the breakfast bar go beyond expectations...with a smile. The complimentary shuttle was a great bonus that I was not aware of before booking; but I used it several times and I was grateful each time for the service. The shuttle was also excellent value for getting to the airport.The pool looked very inviting but unfortunately my stay was short and I didn't get an opportunity to try it out. Next time...and there will be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service does not overcome bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: U G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the last week in September and had bed bugs in my room. The staff was very responsive in moving me at 1:45am when I discovered the pests but I did not sleep the remainder of the night. I took photos of the bugs and emailed them to the general manager but never got a reply. To be certain they were informed I even gave a dead bed bug in a ziplock bag to the front desk. I have no idea if they are taking care of the problem and they do not seem to care that I now am left to try to disinfect my luggage. I'll probably throw out my suitcase just to be certain I have not brought the pests to my home, This is a huge hassle. Responsive service from the front desk but that can't overcome bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: WorldSurfMama
Reviews.Content: Located right off I-15 and Miramar Road, this is a perfect location for military or family members visiting Miramar, especially for air shows. Great pool and hottub outside. There is an exercise room, but its pretty weak (only a couple treadmills and an eliptical, no weights in sight.) There is a restaurant inside, but we've always eaten at our favorite places in San Diego, like the Brigantine, Pizza Port, or Karl Strauss. Unfortunately this place has no breakfast whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “not bad actually!”
Reviews.Author: DentistDoris
Reviews.Content: This took me by surprise since I don't usually stay at Holiday Inns, but my hotel room (at the end of the hallway) was very quiet and clean. It was a king suite with a pull out sofa. Bathroom was big, bright, and nice. Marble countertop? Had a nice cloth bag for the hairdryer in the bathroom. Front desk was polite and friendly. Only downside: the maid knocked on my door at 8:15am on a Saturday to see if we wanted maid service and that woke me up.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: California_05
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a conference and stayed in this Holiday Inn hotel. The front desk service team was always very friendly and helpful. I stayed on a special rate due to the conference, this rate also included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was great! (for people without a coupon, breakfast costs 9.99$) Coffee or tea to go after breakfast was included too. I had a king size, non-smoking room, which was big and clean. It had a microwave, fridge, coffee maker, TV, and hair dryer. The bathroom was big and clean. The hotel has a gym (treatmill, elyptical) and a pool as well as jacuzzi. everything was clean and nice. The hotel offers a free shuttle to a mall which is 15min away by car. This mall is big and has great shops! Definitely worth to visit! The only con of the hotel was its location. San Diego downtown was 25-30 min away by car. When we took a cab from the airport to the hotel, we spend over 50$. We ended up renting a car to get our way around. The hotel is in a commercial area, so there were plenty gas stations but limited amount of restaurants. The chinese restaurant right besides the hotel wasn't very recommendable. The food was greasy and the waitress did not listen to my requests in my order. All in all, a great hotel. Recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: SDFAN080
Reviews.Content: If your looking for comfortable beds, good local, and reasonable cost this is your hotel. Wireless is free, staff is freindly. Other reviews complain about no free breakfast, so what it's only ten bucks and it's hot with an excellent selection of breakfast foods. The only downside to this property is the water pressure in the shower a little on the trickle side. I stay here because you are twenty minutes from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but no free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hap64
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel without knowing what it was (got it off of hot wire for a great deal). Was extremely pleased with everything about it. I should not have complained about the 'no free breakast,' because it told me right on hot wire that complimentary breakfast was not included. We were going to partake in breakfast (that you had to pay for), but we must've gotten down to the eating area too late, because they were cleaning up. We ended up going to a great diner, Keith's, across the street, so no biggie. The hotel staff was extremely friendly/helpful/kind, and the fact that there was free wine and tap beer for guests during happy hour was sweet! Would definitely come back to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: CheapThrills
Reviews.Content: Typical Holiday Inn in a convenient location just off the freeway. The card keys wouldn't work when we first arrived, which was very irritating for someone coming off a long drive (I had to use the bathroom!), but the room was nice enough, and the staff was helpful enough (they fixed the key problem in about a half-hour). The in-room fridge wouldn't get cold, but the ice machine near the lobby worked fine. The biggest bummer was not getting breakfast with the room price. Seriously - shouldn't all hotels do this nowadays? Shouldn't they be trying to entice more customers during these lean times rather than cutting services? I'm not looking for anything fancy, just a simple, convenient, continental breakfast that you can grab as you head out to your next destination. I don't want a breakfast buffet and I don't want to pay $10 per person. Luckily, there's a Carl's Jr. across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: celia_2
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean which is always top priority. The hotel was quiet and the staff was nice although we didn't need anything so I can't say how the service would have been in that aspect. The price was a good value for the room and the bed was pretty comfortable and even though the view wasn't much, the window let in lots of light so I wasn't really bothered. The only thing I was disappointed with was the continental breakfast because it wasn't free and there weren't many options for the price they charged. With as nice as the hotel was, it would be great if they served a complimentary breakfast as well. Overall it was a very good experience and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Moved To Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bad162429
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel in February. They advertise "Newly Renovated". They rooms are EXACTLY the same. They updated the lobby and restaurant, but nothing else. I was paying almost $40.00 more a night with the "Government Discount", and when I asked to have my rate lowered to the $99.00 rate they were offering I was told "No". I checked out and went ONE BLOCK up the street to the Holiday Inn Express Mira Mesa, and enjoyed the rest of my stay in San Diego. I was given a rate of almost 50% LESS ONE BLOCK up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluedove3Texas
Reviews.Content: Wow! Just came back from staying at this site after being there for 5 days to attend the Adidas Phenom Basketball Camp. The breakfast buffett was good. The eggs tasted like eggs should and the fruit was sweet and fresh. The hotel employees were there to help us feel comfortable. The Happy Hour was good too. I don't think you can go wrong here. I did notice they are beginning to start more remodeling, so you may want to check the progress before you decide to check in. And easy access to downtown/airport or take the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, recently renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: coffee_cake_224
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation directly on the hotel’s website for $144/night for 2 double beds. This hotel caters to the business sector so there were a lot people in suits wandering the halls. Parking lot is big & parking is free. The hotel looks exactly as the pictures posted on its website. There's no bellman to help with your luggage. The outside & lobby look new & impressive. However, upon entering our room I realized that this was once an old hotel which has been renovated. All the furniture & décor have been updated, but there were a few tell-tale signs: the ceiling had yellow stains (water damage?), the door to the room & the bathroom doors despite having a fresh coat of paint showed signs of an old motel door from days gone by. Upon checking in, you’re required to sign a piece of paper that states you’ll be charged $250 if you smoke in a non-smoking room. I like that because a few hotels I stayed at before, previous guests smoked in non-smoking rooms. The hotel is undergoing construction so ask for a room on a higher floor. There is complimentary continental breakfast which includes bagels, muffins, pastries, hot oatmeal with raisins, yogurt, apples/oranges, hard-boiled eggs, cereals, toast, peanut butter/jam, apple juice, orange juice, coffee, etc. There’s a happy hour every Mon-Thurs from 5-7 pm. I went once & the theme was Mexican: chili, nachos, deep fried chicken wings & free drinks. Room was small, cozy, clean, has contemporary décor & equipped with a work desk, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer & 2 complimentary Kirkland water bottles. Beds were comfortable. Pillows were soft, downfill type. There’s a pillow menu by the phone for you to request from the front desk if you want a firm or soft pillow. Remember to ensure the door shuts completely after you leave your room. Sometimes, it doesn't shut completely. Bathroom was large with plenty of counter space. There’s a magnifying mirror by the sink for the ladies to apply makeup. Toiletries included a bar soap, small bottles of shampoo, conditioner & lotion that have a mint scent. Water pressure is strong & excellent. There’s no fan in the bathroom though. There’s a business centre with free internet access in an enclosed, motion-sensored room across from the front desk. You have to check with the front desk before & after you use the computer because they monitor who’s using it. The lights in the room will turn off (motion-sensored) so just move your arm/chair to activate the lights again. There’s a gas station next to the hotel. The hotel is located conveniently next to the freeway entrance to get to the airport.. It took about 20 minutes to get to the airport. Traffic was not that bat at 9 am. Overall, the hotel is clean, comfortable & I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: bec060874
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for business. My room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly. It is very close to Miramar so you can hear the jets very loudly. Also, while we were there, the restaurant was under construction so they had a free continental breakfast in a tiny conference room....food wasn't that great. It's also a bit challenging getting in and out of the property because of where it's situated on Miramar Rd - you have to wait for a long light to turn onto the main road, and also to turn back into the hotel. Otherwise the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TexasShasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn San Diego North Miramar Thanksgiving week. It's location was excellent for our visit with our USMC son living near the base at Miramar. We have stayed in several other area hotels on earlier visits and this will now be our first choice for a hotel in the vicinity. The location, just off I-15, made travel to other areas easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and quite large. The breakfast was much better than the normal included fare. We even had real plates, flatware and glasses. There is an afternoon 'happy hour' gathering, but since we were visiting family, we didn't participate. The hotel is obviously a regular stop for business travelers who knew the staff and other guests. We were looking for a place to sleep and begin our day with breakfast. We didn't use the pool or other facilities. There is a restaurant on-site. The entire package for the price was a pleasant surprise. Our experience was great. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall 100% Complete Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: KBRZEZNIAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week between Christmas and New Years and were pleasantly surprised. Starting with the front desk staff - they were all very friendly and accomodating. We arrived a bit before check in time and were able to get our room immediately. The condition of the room was good. Not worn or outdated. I am rather picky about these things too! The hotel was centrally located between all of the attractions we were interested in, so that was quite convenient. Wild Animal Park, SeaWorld, LaJolla and Downtown for a whale watching tour. If you have a 8 - 18 year old boy traveling with you check out the Miramar Speed Circuit (only about 5 minutes away). They have go cart racing and my son and husband loved it. It was included with the Go SanDiego card and we had to stop there each morning before we did anything else so they could try to beat their lap time from the day before! The hotel continental breakfast was good with a large selection of items and not too crowded in the seating area. We didn't use the pool or hot tub due to the season we were there. We will definitely stay here again when passing through San Diego. Great value for the money. If you're going to be out all day every day doing things why spend $250 or $300 a night on a room when you can stay here for a little over a $100?

Reviews.Title: “nice for a quick jaunt”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for pleasure to visit local area. Arrived really early(8:30am) and the front desk accomodated our request for an early check in(it took 20 minutes to have our room ready). Also, they had a small business center to work in while I waited for the room to be ready. The room and bathroom was clean. Room also had a refrig and microwave. There was breakfast and happy hour. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: adultrunaways
Reviews.Content: hotel stay was mar,24-27 2007 let us check in early.here for nascar race in fontana,,.suite was nice for the days that we were here but the fridge was not as cold as it should be. called downstairs and was told that i could bring my drinks downstairs [pop,water,juice] and put in their fridge.i declined and said thank you for the offer.came back from the race late on sunday 10pm,and the front door was not completely shut [locked].i went downstairs and told them and they said they would send security with me and check the room out.my wife and myself checked it out before i went down to the front desk.they said that they were very sorry and it would not happen again,she said she would notify housekeeping of what had happened.she called my room about an hour later and said how sorry she was about what had happened. i thought that that was very awesome of her too call back at a later time a say she was sorry for what had happened.i told her that i will be back in sept. and said thank you. thumbs up too her

Reviews.Title: “Mold!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bickyd
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Sept. 29, 2006. The room was sparten, the refriderator did not work, and the tv was old with a poor quality picture. If that wasn't bad enough, while trying to open the Heat/AC vent in the bathroom, the grill pulled out of the wall and the inside of the ventalation shaft was completely covered with Black Mold!, some of which fell onto the floor(I have pictures). Almost an inch thick! Needless to say my wife and I got out of there rather quickly. I have contacted their corporate customer care via e-mail(the Only way to contact them) and have still not heard back from them(10/4/06)

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nankie
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and 13 y.o. daughter stayed here over a busy weekend in July '06. The hotel was filled to capacity (as were just about every other hotel in the area) because of several large athletic competitions that were going on that weekend. The hotel really took advantage of this fact and jacked the price up to $209/ night (not the "average" price of $139 listed on this site). Although I had made the reservation just the night before, they managed to get it wrong - and sent us to a room with only one bed - not the two we had been promised. However, the young woman at the desk (Russian, I believe) was very helpful & apologetic, and even offered to take $50 off the bill for our trouble...and quickly gave us a different room. The room itself was all right, as was the bathroom - what you'd expect from a Holiday Inn - not super fancy, but clean and adequate. However, the overall feel of the hotel and breakfast room is a bit dated. Also, the location is kind of drab - wih a view of the parking lot & freeway. The pool area was small and not very attractive, and so crowded that night with screaming kids, that our idea of sitting there peacefully was immediately vetoed. The included breakfat wasn't too bad - my husband liked the oatmeal - but again, the room felt small & a bit shabby. The most distressing aspect of our stay was the steady stream of ants crawling over the desk in our room. We didn't complain because at that point I knew there were no other rooms available - but I mentioned it in the comment card I left at the desk when we checked out - but never heard from anyone (card is probably sitting in the trash somewhere!) In short, an okay place - but nothing special - and definitely overpriced at $209 (for $139 I would say it would be acceptable).

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for vacationing in S.D.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often visit San Diego and took a chance by staying at this hotel which is farther away from the tourist trap in San Diego....but we will not make that mistake again. In my opnion, this hotel is perfect for the business traveler but not if you have a family or plan to experience San Diego. It is located far from attractions, restaurants, and shopping. The Holiday Inn located on Hotel Circle is a much better choice. As for quality, if you like Holiday Inn, you will like this hotel. But be warned that there are no good views, its located off of the busy freeway and worse, right in line with the flight path of the nearby small airport. Not very peaceful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn Miramar”
Reviews.Author: threets
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego with three kids, one spouse and my parents. We stayed in a suite for $119 a night. I am a cheap traveler so it sounded too good to be true, and I was very pleased to find out that it was all true. It was an excellent hotel, very clean, nice staff and a good continental breakfast. The bathroom was the best part of all with the curved shower curtain and an awesome shower head. It was too cold for swimming but we spent a little time in the hot tub, which was lukewarm, but the sauna made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night's Rest”
Reviews.Author: theCFamily
Reviews.Content: I always refer to Tripadvisor for reviews. Its always been helpful to me so I thought I'd put my review to help you readers. I booked a suite for my family and were impressed with what was offered. I called the hotel to inform them that we will be arriving past 12AM. The lobby was secured afterhours so you have to ring the front doorbell for assistance. The staff was very friendly even after our 2a.m. arrival. The lobby was very clean and spacious. Our suite accommodated 6 people comfortably. The living room had its private door. The sofa bed was clean and the room was spacious with a small kitchenette to the side. This suite had 2 TVs. The bedrooms had 2 double beds and were very comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was very clean with a nice shower massage. The towels were clean and fluffy. No sign of mold or mildew anywhere. Due to our short stay, I don't know if there was a pool. This hotel is right off HWY 15 and several miles from HWY 5. They offer complimentary breakfast which had a good selection. Your choice of different types of muffins and pastries, cereal, hot oatmeal, a variety of juices, milk, coffee, fruits, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, and you can even toast your breads. Cost of the suite-$144./night. Check out their website for different available discounts such as AAA, AARP, Entertainment, State, Fed, Military etc. They have a big FREE parking lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in May of 2005 and were rather impressed by its simple touches. The check-in staff was friendly and efficient, and our mini-suite was clean and welcoming. There was a refrigerator, a sink, a microwave, flatware, and silverware in the kitchenette in the front room. There were also two bottles of water and a package of microwaveable popcorn on the table in front of the couch (with a pull-out bed inside). I know that is minor, but it was a pleasant gesture. A desk and a television were also in this front room. The front room could be closed off by a door that separated it from the bedroom and bathroom. The bedroom contained a spacious king bed, a clock radio alarm, curtains that effectively blocked out the morning sun, two night tables, drawers, a chair, and a second television. The sink is separate from the rest of the bathroom and is located by a built-in hair dryer. The toiletries provided by the hotel were another detail that added a charm; two shampoos, a conditioner, lotion, and mouthwash were all supplied on the counter. The hotel was right off of the 15 freeway- which is a little bit out of the way from the heart of San Diego, but there was a restaurant next door, a complimentary continental breakfast, good service, free parking, and an affordable rate that made this hotel pleasurable stop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: redshoetraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually called the Holiday Inn Select North Miramar. I don't know if the name change is new, but it is at this address and is the one pictured. We had an excellent stay at this hotel for one night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean, comfortable, and spacious. This hotel received the highest rating for Holiday Inns in the region, and yet the rate was excellent...much lower than other hotels in most areas of San Diego. It's farther from downtown and star attractions, but not very far. It took us about 10 minutes to drive to Sea World. They serve a free breakfast that consists of a good variety of muffins, bagels, yogurts, juices, coffee, danishes, cereal, etc. A good continental breakfast. They also have free drinks and appetizers in the evening, but we didn't go to that. There aren't very many restaurants immediately around the hotel, but there is a fair selection within a short drive. I would definitely stay here again if in San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego North Miramar
HotelInfo.Address: 9335 Kearny Mesa Road, San Diego, CA 92126
